01_data_basics/01_counting/05_read_frequency_distribution_v3

A random procedure generated 130 measurements, which were organized into the frequency distribution shown below. You can assume the measurements are of a continuous random variable, such that every measurement is in one of the intervals (and not on a break).

interval frequency
54 — 56 4
56 — 58 10
58 — 60 8
60 — 62 9
62 — 64 10
64 — 66 10
66 — 68 28
68 — 70 51

  1. Evaluate \(\#[\mathbf{x}<68]\).
  2. Evaluate \(\#[\mathbf{x}>58]\).
  3. Evaluate \(\#[|\mathbf{x}-63|<1]\).
  4. Evaluate \(\#[|\mathbf{x}-58|>2]\).
  5. Find boundary \(b\) such that \(\#[\mathbf{x}<b] = 79\).
  6. Find boundary \(b\) such that \(\#[\mathbf{x}>b] = 126\).
  7. Find radius \(r\) such that \(\#[|\mathbf{x}-60|<r] = 17\).
  8. Find radius \(r\) such that \(\#[|\mathbf{x}-62|>r] = 55\).
